workout_file.author: Zwift
workout_file.name: Week 4.2 - Easy Big Gear
workout_file.description: A zone 2 ride featuring low cadence work intervals.

textevent.message: Welcome to an easy zone 2 workout today, let's get started with a warmup.
Aim for ~85 RPM here.
Hopefully you're starting to feel warmed up. Let's chat a little about today.
As you know, today is a low key zone 2 focused ride.
With some 'big gear' efforts thrown into the mix.
Big gear because the cadence will be low ~75 RPM.
Mimicking the demands of turning over a large gear.
But overall today, nothing too demanding and a break from the intensity.
Let's carry on with the warmup.
Just a bit longer and we'll start our 1st interval.
Aim for 90 RPM for this 1st one.
Bring the cadence up just slightly and settle into things here.
Good work so far, settle down and get into the groove.
Be sure to drink frequently today.
Aiming to finish 1 bottle over the course of this hour.
Another minute here, then we'll lower the cadence to 75 RPM.
Just a bit more effort now, and bring the cadence down.
Focus on your pedal form here - 'push, scrape, pull, and kick'.
Do you feel like you struggle with 1 quadrant of the pedal stroke?
If so, try to focus on that one over the next few minutes.
Good work, now pedal normally and work through all the quadrants equally.
Hopefully you feel you're struggling less through that quadrant now.
But, don't fret if you are, just keep practicing :-)
Going back up to 90 RPM next.
Nicely done! Lower the intensity a bit here and increase the cadence again.
Can you separate each quadrant of the pedal stroke at this RPM?
Give it a try, and focus again on the quadrant you struggled with before.
Good, back to a normal pedal stroke again. Hopefully things are feeling smoother.
Up next, we're going to drop the cadence again to 75 RPM.
Push, scrape, pull, kick, keep it up!
Feel free to stand up as needed if you need a stretch
More than halfway through this interval!
Hopefully the legs are feeling better than when we started today.
Our last interval is just ahead, we're going to finish up at 90 RPM again.
Let's keep at the same intensity, but increase the pedal velocity.
Release any tension in those shoulders and have a light grip on the bars.
Almost there now! Thank you for respecting the low intensity of today.
They all can't be super high intensity and having balance to your training is important.
Last minute now, let's finish this up!
Way to go! That was an easy day, but still important to your success and progress.
We'll spend a few minutes cooling down now.
See you next time :-)
